citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One female Bernese mountain dog microchip number 15202 was observed with dried red fluid throughout its housing
area. The licensee stated that the dog had had some residual bleeding after whelping but had not spoke to the attending
veterinarian regarding the issue. Excessive bleeding after whelping can be an indicator of an internal injury and can lead
to infection in the dog. The licensee must ensure that appropriate methods are used to prevent, control, diagnose, and
treat diseases and injuries. Correct by January 20, 2023.

The facility has been treating a male Yorkshire terrier microchip number 44807 for an eye issue for 2 days. The facility
has also been treating a female Bernese Mountain dog microchip number 15202 for bleeding after whelping for
approximately 5 days. Medical notes have not been recorded for these 2 dogs. Failure to maintain medical notes of
medical problems such as disease, illness, and injury prevents APHIS officials from determining if an animal is receiving
appropriate veterinary care. The licensee must ensure that if a problem is identified, the date and description of the
problem, examination findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed are
documented. Correct by January 23, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
